alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 5:21PM EDT until July 04 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Clinton County in northern New York... Northeastern Essex County in northern New York... Southern Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... West central Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 521 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Harkness, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... South Burlington, Burlington, Essex, Peru, Schuyler Falls, Willsboro, Port Kent, Keeseville, Shelburne, Charlotte, Williston, St. George, Colchester, Mcneil Cove, Sloop Island, Shelburne Falls, Wings Point, Meach Island, Hatch Point, and Willsboro Point. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Champlain should seek safe harbor now! Strong winds will cause higher waves and sudden wind shifts may overturn boats. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
